bibl.title: Letter from M.J. Rosenau to Henry Rose Carter, October 29, 1924

div1.p: Rosenau writes that he is unable to locate "Huacabamba" on a map. He comments on an outbreak of plague in San Antonio, Texas.

div1.head: Letter from M.J. Rosenau to Henry Rose Carter, October 29, 1924
div1.opener:
HARVARD UNIVERSITY
MEDICAL SCHOOL
DEPARTMENT OF PREVENTIVE MEDICINE AND HYGIENE
Boston, Massachusetts.
October 29, 1924.
Dr. H. R. Carter,
2122 California St., N. W.,
Washington, D. C.
Dear Dr. Carter:
div1.p:
I cannot find “Huacabamba” on the map.
There is a city Huancabamba in the province of Huanuco in
Peru, and also a Huacaybamba in the province of Piura in
Peru.

It seems to me that the outbreak of
plague at and about the pueblo of San Antonio ought to be
published, for the relationship to guinea pigs is better
than most of our epidemiological data.
